message.content:
cs.NI, cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.Distributed, cs.SY

Reasoning: 
1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper proposes a framework that uses wireless mobile miners for computation purposes in a blockchain system. The system requires low-latency wireless communications between mobile miners and communication nodes, which falls under the scope of networking and internet architecture.
2. cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) - The paper discusses the proof-of-work computation used in blockchain systems to verify the originality of data. This involves cryptography and security measures to prevent attacks on the system.
3. cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) - The paper proposes a distributed system where the blockchain ledger is located at communication nodes and mobile miners process the proof-of-work computation. This falls under the scope of distributed computing.
4. cs.Distributed (Distributed Computing) - Similar to cs.DC, the paper proposes a distributed system for blockchain computation using mobile miners.
5. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper proposes a system for blockchain computation using mobile miners and analyzes its performance. This falls under the scope of systems and control.
